body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Ky

Your petitioner Samuel B Hughs will state his case as followeth, that he is Indicted in the Union Circuit Court for Stabbing Coffee with the intent to kill -- : this Indictment was made about five years ago next spring. that he has urged a trail ever since and the case is yet continued, and your petitioner has urged a trial, under the provision of the Federal Constitution which declares that the accused shall have a fare & speedy trial &c -- he is bound by recognizance for his appearance from court to court, and he wishes to be freed from his bonds -- he will State that at the time the supposed offence was committed, he was attending an Exposition on a show boat on the Ohio river and in walking down the steps of the boat in company with his friend Coffee, he made some remark to him, & intended to Strike him on the shoulder to elicit his attendion, he had an open knife in his hand, and owing to the fact that he had drank to much liquor, he accidently inflicted a Small would in Coffee's Shoulder -- that he had no grudge or malice against Coffee at the time and has had none since -- that Coffee & your petitioner, were friends before and ever after the accident, he wishes to change his location
under existing Circumstances and as he can not leave Union County in Consequence of his recognizance & surities until april next, and from present appearances he has no hope then of a trial under these Extraordinary Circumstances, he prays for the interposition of Executive Clemency and prays for the issue of a pardon for said supposed offence and as in duty bound he will ever pray
Saml B Hughs states what he has stated in this peition he believes to be true S B Hughs
subscribed & sworn to before me by S B Hughs in due form of law this 25th of Novr 1861

Union Cir. Ct
Indictment for Manslaughter
Saml B Hughes
Issd Decr 18 1861
